All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
Activator<T>
Interface for an activating function in a neural network.
Circle
 
CrossEntropyLoss
Class to represent the cross entropy loss function for classification networks.
DataGenerator<T>
Class to randomly generate datapoints and categorise them according to a given rule or provide an output value if we are regressing.
DataSplitter
Class to split a dataset into training, validation and testing, given a split ratio.
Edge
Class to represent an Edge joining two Neurons of a Network
Header
Enum to represent the column headers of a dataframe for datapoints.
Layer
Class to represent one Layer of a Network.
LeakyReLU
Class to represent a leaky ReLU function (can be just a ReLU if the leak is set to 0.0), which is an Activator for Neurons.
Learner
Base class for Trainer, Validator and Tester.
MSELoss
Class to test the mean squared error loss for regression networks.
Network
Class to represent the whole network.
Neuron
Class to represent a single Neuron in a Network.
NormalDataGenerator<T>
Class to randomly generate datapoints and categorise them according to a given rule, or provide an output value if we are regressing, with data being generated via a normal distribution.
Partitioner
Class to randomly partition numInts integers into sets of size setSize.
Plotter
Class to create plots evaluating the performance of the neural network.
Sigmoid
Class to represent the sigmoid function, which is an Activator for Neurons
Softmax
Class to represent a softmax function.
Tester
Class to test a neural network
Trainer
Class to train a neural network.
TransferFunction
A class to represent the transfer function of a neural network, which creates a linear combination of weights from values of Neurons.
UniformDataGenerator<T>
Class to randomly generate datapoints and categorise them according to a given rule, or provide an output value if we are regressing, with data being generated via a uniform distribution.
Validator
Class to validate a neural network.
WeightedPartitioner
Class to create a number of sets of size setSize from a list of numInts integers weighted by which ground truth class each integer lies in.
